Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-301 Short title.
-------------------------------------------
This part is known as the "Impaired Persons Licensing Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-302 Definitions.
-------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-302(1): 53-3-303 "Board" means the Driver License Medical Advisory Board created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-302(2): "Health care professional" means a physician or surgeon licensed to practice medicine in the state, or when recommended by the Medical Advisory Board, may include other health care professionals licensed to conduct physical examinations in this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-302(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-302(3)(a): "Impaired person" means a person who has a mental, emotional, or nonstable physical disability or disease that may impair the person's ability to exercise reasonable and ordinary control at all times over a motor vehicle while driving on the highways.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-302(3)(b): "Impaired person" does not include a person having a nonprogressive or stable physical impairment that is objectively observable and that may be evaluated by a functional driving examination.


Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-303 Driver License Medical Advisory Board -- Membership -- Guidelines for licensing impaired persons -- Recommendations to division.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-303(1): There is created within the division the Driver License Medical Advisory Board.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-303(2): (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-303(2)(a): The board is comprised of three regular members appointed by the Commissioner of Public Safety to four-year terms.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-303(2)(b): The board shall be assisted by expert panel members nominated by the board as necessary and as approved by the Commissioner of Public Safety.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-303(2)(c): (2)(a) Notwithstanding the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-303(2)(d): When a vacancy occurs in the membership for any reason, the replacement shall be appointed for the unexpired term.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-303(2)(e): The expert panel members shall recommend medical standards in the areas of the panel members' special competence for determining the physical, mental, and emotional capabilities of applicants for licenses and licensees.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-303(3): In reviewing individual cases, a panel acting with the authority of the board consists of at least two members, of which at least one is a regular board member.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-303(4): The director of the division or his designee serves as secretary to the board and its panels.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-303(5): Members of the board and expert panel members nominated by them shall be health care professionals.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-303(6): 63A-3-106; 63A-3-107; 63A-3-106; 63A-3-107 A member may not receive compensation or benefits for the member's service, but may receive per diem and travel expenses in accordance with:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-303(6)(a): 63A-3-106 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-303(6)(b): 63A-3-107 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-303(6)(c): 63A-3-106; 63A-3-107 rules made by the Division of Finance pursuant to Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-303(7): The board shall meet from time to time when called by the director of the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-303(8): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-303(8)(a): The board shall recommend guidelines and standards for determining the physical, mental, and emotional capabilities of applicants for licenses and for licensees.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-303(8)(b): The guidelines and standards are applicable to all Utah licensees and for all individuals who hold learner permits and are participating in driving activities in all forms of driver education.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-303(8)(c): The guidelines and standards shall be published by the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-303(9): If the division has reason to believe that an applicant or licensee is an impaired person, it may:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-303(9)(a): act upon the matter based upon the published guidelines and standards; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-303(9)(b): convene a panel to consider the matter and submit findings and a recommendation; the division shall consider the recommendation along with other evidence in determining whether a license should be suspended, revoked, denied, disqualified, canceled, or restricted.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-303(10): (9)
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-303(10)(a): (9) If the division has acted under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-303(10)(b): The panel shall review the matters and make written findings and conclusions.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-303(10)(c): The division shall affirm or modify its previous action.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-303(11): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-303(11)(a): Actions of the division are subject to judicial review as provided in this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-303(11)(b): The guidelines, standards, findings, conclusions, and recommendations of the board or of a panel are admissible as evidence in any judicial review.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-303(12): Members of the board and its panels incur no liability for recommendations, findings, conclusions, or for other acts performed in good faith and incidental to membership on the board or a panel.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-303(13): The division shall provide forms for the use of health care professionals in depicting the medical history of any physical, mental, or emotional impairment affecting the applicant's or licensee's ability to drive a motor vehicle.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-303(14): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-303(14)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-303(14)(a)(i): Individuals who apply for or hold a license and have, or develop, or suspect that they have developed a physical, mental, or emotional impairment that may affect driving safety are responsible for reporting this to the division or its agent.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-303(14)(a)(ii): If there is uncertainty, the individual is expected to seek competent medical evaluation and advice as to the significance of the impairment as it relates to driving safety, and to refrain from driving until a clarification is made.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-303(14)(b): Health care professionals who care for patients with physical, mental, or emotional impairments that may affect their driving safety, whether defined by published guidelines and standards or not, are responsible for making available to their patients without reservation their recommendations and appropriate information related to driving safety and responsibilities.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-303(14)(c): A health care professional or other person who becomes aware of a physical, mental, or emotional impairment that appears to present an imminent threat to driving safety and reports this information to the division in good faith has immunity from any damages claimed as a result of making the report.

Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-304 Licensing of persons with impairments -- Medical review -- Restricted license -- Procedures.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-304(1): (1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-304(1)(a): If the division has reason to believe that an applicant for a license or a mobility vehicle permit is a person with an impairment, the division may require one or both of the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-304(1)(a)(i): a physical examination of the applicant by a health care professional and the submittal by the health care professional of a signed medical report indicating the results of the physical examination;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-304(1)(a)(ii): a follow-up medical review of the applicant by a health care professional and completion of a medical report at intervals established by the division under standards recommended by the board.

Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-304(2)(b): The division may grant a restricted mobility vehicle permit to a person with an impairment who is otherwise qualified to obtain a mobility vehicle permit.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-304(2)(c): The license or mobility vehicle permit continues in effect until its expiration date so long as the licensee complies with the requirements set forth by the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-304(2)(d): The license or mobility vehicle permit renewal is subject to the conditions of this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-304(2)(e): Any physical, mental, or emotional impairment of the applicant that in the opinion of the division does not affect the applicant's ability to exercise reasonable and ordinary control at all times in driving a motor vehicle upon the highway, does not prevent granting a license or mobility vehicle permit to the applicant.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-304(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-304(3)(a): If an examination is required under this section, the division is not bound by the recommendation of the examining health care professional but shall give fair consideration to the recommendation in acting upon the application.  The criterion is whether upon all the evidence it is safe to permit the applicant to drive a motor vehicle or mobility vehicle.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-304(3)(b): In deciding whether to grant or deny a license or mobility vehicle permit, the division may be guided by the opinion of experts in the fields of diagnosing and treating mental, physical, or emotional disabilities and may take into consideration any other factors that bear on the issue of public safety.

Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-401 Short title.
-------------------------------------------
This part is known as the "Uniform Commercial Driver License Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-401.1 Conflict with Federal Motor Carrier Safety Regulations.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Federal Motor Carrier Safety Regulations supersede any conflicting provisions of this chapter pertaining to licensing of commercial motor vehicle operators.

Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-402 Definitions.
-------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-402(1): "Alcohol" means any substance containing any form of alcohol, including ethanol, methanol, propanol, and isopropanol.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-402(2): "Alcohol concentration" means the number of grams of alcohol per:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-402(2)(a): 100 milliliters of blood;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-402(2)(b): 210 liters of breath; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-402(2)(c): 67 milliliters of urine.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-402(3): "Commercial driver license information system" or "CDLIS" means the information system established under Title XII, Pub. L. 99-570, the Commercial Motor Vehicle Safety Act of 1986, as a clearinghouse for information related to the licensing and identification of commercial motor vehicle drivers.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-402(4): "Controlled substance" means any substance so classified under Section 102(6) of the Controlled Substance Act, 21 U.S.C. 802(6), and includes all substances listed on the current Schedules I through V of 21 C.F.R., Part 1308 as they may be revised from time to time.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-402(5): "Employee" means any driver of a commercial motor vehicle, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-402(5)(a): full-time, regularly employed drivers;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-402(5)(b): casual, intermittent, or occasional drivers;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-402(5)(c): leased drivers; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-402(5)(d): independent, owner-operator contractors while in the course of driving a commercial motor vehicle who are either directly employed by or under lease to an employer.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-402(6): "Employer" means any individual or person including the United States, a state, or a political subdivision of a state, who owns or leases a commercial motor vehicle, or assigns an individual to drive a commercial motor vehicle.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-402(7): "Felony" means any offense under state or federal law that is punishable by death or imprisonment for a term of more than one year.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-402(8): "Foreign jurisdiction" means any jurisdiction other than the United States or a state of the United States.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-402(9): "Gross vehicle weight rating" or "GVWR" means the value specified by the manufacturer as the maximum loaded weight of a single vehicle or GVWR of a combination or articulated vehicle, and includes the GVWR of the power unit plus the total weight of all towed units and the loads on those units.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-402(10): "Hazardous material" has the same meaning as defined under 49 C.F.R. Sec. 383.5.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-402(11): "Imminent hazard" means the existence of a condition, practice, or violation that presents a substantial likelihood that death, serious illness, severe personal injury, or a substantial endangerment to health, property, or the environment is expected to occur immediately, or before the condition, practice, or violation can be abated.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-402(12): 53-3-303.5; 53-3-304; 53-3-414 "Medical certification status" means the medical certification of a commercial driver license holder or commercial motor vehicle operator in any of the following categories:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-402(12)(a): Non-excepted interstate.  A person shall certify that the person:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-402(12)(a)(i): operates or expects to operate in interstate commerce;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-402(12)(a)(ii): is both subject to and meets the qualification requirements under 49 C.F.R.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-402(12)(a)(iii): is required to obtain a medical examiner's certificate under 49 C.F.R. Sec. 391.45.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-402(12)(b): Excepted interstate.  A person shall certify that the person:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-402(12)(b)(i): operates or expects to operate in interstate commerce, but engages exclusively in transportation or operations excepted under 49 C.F.R. Sec. 390.3(f), 391.2, 391.68, or 398.3 from all or parts of the qualification requirements of 49 C.F.R.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-402(12)(b)(ii): is not required to obtain a medical examiner's certificate under 49 C.F.R. Sec. 391.45.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-402(12)(c): 53-3-303.5; 53-3-304; 53-3-414 Non-excepted intrastate.  A person shall certify that the person:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-402(12)(c)(i): operates only in intrastate commerce; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-402(12)(c)(ii): 53-3-303.5; 53-3-304; 53-3-414 is subject to state driver qualification requirements under Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-402(12)(d): Excepted intrastate.  A person shall certify that the person:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-402(12)(d)(i): operates in intrastate commerce; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-402(12)(d)(ii): engages exclusively in transportation or operations excepted from all parts of the state driver qualification requirements.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-402(13): "NDR" means the National Driver Register.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-402(14): "Nonresident CDL" means a commercial driver license issued by a state to an individual who resides in a foreign jurisdiction.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-402(15): "Out-of-service order" means a temporary prohibition against driving a commercial motor vehicle.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-402(16): 72-1-102 "Port-of-entry agent" has the same meaning as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-402(17): 53-3-404; 41-6a-1716 "Serious traffic violation" means a conviction of any of the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-402(17)(a): speeding 15 or more miles per hour above the posted speed limit;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-402(17)(b): reckless driving as defined by state or local law;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-402(17)(c): improper or erratic traffic lane changes;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-402(17)(d): following the vehicle ahead too closely;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-402(17)(e): any other motor vehicle traffic law which arises in connection with a fatal traffic accident;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-402(17)(f): operating a commercial motor vehicle without a CDL or a CDIP;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-402(17)(g): operating a commercial motor vehicle without the proper class of CDL or CDL endorsement for the type of vehicle group being operated or for the passengers or cargo being transported;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-402(17)(h): 53-3-404 operating a commercial motor vehicle without a CDL or CDIP license certificate in the driver's possession in violation of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-402(17)(i): 41-6a-1716 using a wireless communication device in violation of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-402(17)(j): using a hand-held mobile telephone while operating a commercial motor vehicle in violation of 49 C.F.R. Sec. 392.82.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-402(18): "State" means a state of the United States, the District of Columbia, any province or territory of Canada, or Mexico.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-402(19): "United States" means the 50 states and the District of Columbia.

This part supersedes the general licensing provisions of state law contained in

Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-404 Requirements to drive commercial motor vehicle.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-404(1): 53-3-408 A person may not drive a commercial motor vehicle, unless the person has been issued and is in immediate possession of:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-404(1)(a): a CDL license certificate valid for the commercial motor vehicle the person is driving; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-404(1)(b): 53-3-408 a valid CDIP license certificate in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-404(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-404(2)(a): A licensee shall display a CDL or CDIP license certificate upon demand of a justice court judge, a peace officer, a special function officer, a port-of-entry officer, or a designee of the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-404(2)(b): It is a defense to a charge under this section that the person charged produces in court a CDL or CDIP license certificate that is issued to the person and valid at the time of the citation or arrest.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-404(3): 53-3-402 A person may not drive a commercial motor vehicle if the person's privilege to drive a commercial motor vehicle is:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-404(3)(a): suspended, revoked, or canceled;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-404(3)(b): subject to a disqualification;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-404(3)(c): subject to an out-of-service order; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-404(3)(d): 53-3-402 not medically certified as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-404(4): A person may not drive a commercial motor vehicle if the commercial motor vehicle is subject to an out-of-service order.


Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-405 Authority to drive commercial motor vehicle in Utah.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-405(1): A person who holds or is required to hold a CDL may drive a commercial motor vehicle in this state if:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-405(1)(a): the person has a CDL issued by any state in accordance with the minimum federal standards for the issuance of commercial motor vehicle driver licenses;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-405(1)(b): the person's license is not denied, suspended, revoked, or canceled;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-405(1)(c): the person is not disqualified from driving a commercial motor vehicle; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-405(1)(d): the person has a valid medical certification status.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-405(2): This section supersedes any provision to the contrary.


Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-406 Commercial motor vehicle driver -- Only one license.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Any person who drives a commercial motor vehicle may only have one license.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-407(4)(a): the test is the same test as prescribed by the division, and is administered in the same manner; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-407(4)(b): the party authorized under this section to administer the test has entered into an agreement with the state that complies with the requirements of 49 C.F.R. Sec. 383.75.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-407(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-407(5)(a): An out-of-state resident who holds a valid CDIP issued by a state or jurisdiction that is compliant with 49 C.F.R.

Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-407(5)(c)(i): electronically transmit skills test results for an out-of-state resident to the licensing agency in the state or jurisdiction in which the person has obtained a valid CDIP; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-407(5)(c)(ii): provide the out-of-state resident with documentary evidence upon successful completion of the skills test.

Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-407(8): The division may waive the skills test required under this section if it determines that the applicant meets the requirements of 49 C.F.R. Sec. 383.77.

Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-407.1(2)(b): The division shall request the Department of Public Safety to complete a Federal Bureau of Investigation criminal background check for each commercial driver license third party tester or third party examiner applicant through the national criminal history system or any successor system.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-407.1(2)(c): (2) The Utah Bureau of Criminal Identification shall release to the division all information received in response to the division's request under this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-407.1(2)(d): (2) A commercial driver license third party tester or third party examiner license may not be issued under this section until the criminal background check required under this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-407.1(2)(e): (2); (2)(e) In addition to any fees imposed under this chapter, the division shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-407.1(2)(e)(i): (2) impose on individuals submitting fingerprints in accordance with this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-407.1(2)(e)(ii): (2)(e) remit the fees collected under this Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-407.1(3)(a): minimum standards for a commercial driver license third party tester or third party examiner license;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-407.1(3)(b): procedures for an applicant to apply for a commercial driver license third party tester or third party examiner license;

Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-407.1(3)(d): procedures to enable a licensed commercial driver license third party tester or commercial driver license third party examiner to administer or process a commercial driver license skills test for an applicant to receive a commercial driver license.


Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-408 Qualifications for commercial driver instruction permit.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-408(1): The division may issue a CDIP to a person who:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-408(1)(a): is 18 years of age or older;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-408(1)(b): holds a valid license;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-408(1)(c): has at least one year of driving experience; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-408(1)(d): has passed the vision and knowledge test for the class of license for which the person is applying.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-408(2): The division may issue a CDIP only for a period not to exceed 180 days.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-408(3): The holder of a CDIP may drive a commercial motor vehicle on a highway only when accompanied by a person who:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-408(3)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-408(3)(a)(i): holds a CDL valid for the class and endorsements of commercial motor vehicle driven; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-408(3)(a)(ii): is certified by the division to administer driver licensing examinations to CDL applicants; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-408(3)(b): occupies a seat beside the individual for the purpose of:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-408(3)(b)(i): giving the driver instruction regarding the driving of the commercial motor vehicle; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-408(3)(b)(ii): administering a driver licensing examination to a CDL applicant.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-408(4): A CDL or CDIP may not be issued to a person:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-408(4)(a): subject to disqualification from driving a commercial motor vehicle; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-408(4)(b): whose license is suspended, revoked, or canceled in any state.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-408(5): A CDL or CDIP may not be issued to a person until the person has surrendered all license certificates the person holds to the division for cancellation.

Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-410(1)(g): a complete list of all states in which the applicant was issued a driver license in the previous 10 years upon:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-410(1)(g)(i): initial issuance of a Utah license;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-410(1)(g)(ii): renewal of a CDL for the first time after September 30, 2002; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-410(1)(g)(iii): transfer of a CDL from another state;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-410(1)(h): the applicant's signature;

Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-410(1)(i)(i): that a person is:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-410(1)(i)(i)(A): a United States Citizen;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-410(1)(i)(i)(B): a United States national; or

Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-410(1)(i)(ii): of the applicant's:

Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-410(1)(i)(ii)(E): approved deferred action status;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-410(1)(i)(ii)(F): pending application for adjustment of status to legal permanent resident or conditional resident; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-410(1)(i)(ii)(G): conditional permanent resident alien status; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-410(1)(j): beginning on January 30, 2012, a medical certification status.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-410(2): An application under this section shall also include all certifications required by 49 C.F.R., Part 383.71.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-410(3): When the holder of a license under this part changes the holder's name, mailing address, or residence, the holder shall make application for a duplicate license within 30 days of the change.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-410(4): A person who has been a resident of this state for 30 consecutive days may not drive a commercial motor vehicle under the authority of a commercial driver license issued by another jurisdiction.

Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-411 Description of CDL -- Information to be included.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-411(1): The CDL certificate shall be printed with the identifying words "Commercial Driver License" or "CDL".
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-411(2): To the maximum extent practicable, the CDL certificate shall be resistant to alteration.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-411(3): The CDL certificate shall include:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-411(3)(a): the legal name and principal place of residence of the holder;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-411(3)(b): the holder's photograph in color;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-411(3)(c): a physical description of the holder, including sex and height;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-411(3)(d): the holder's birth date;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-411(3)(e): the holder's Utah license certificate number;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-411(3)(f): the holder's signature;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-411(3)(g): the class or type of commercial motor vehicle or vehicles the holder is authorized to drive;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-411(3)(h): any endorsements or restrictions to which the holder is subject;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-411(3)(i): the name of the issuing state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-411(3)(j): the dates between which the CDL is valid.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-411(4): The CDL may not include the holder's Social Security number.


Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-412 CDL classifications, endorsements, and restrictions.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-412(1): A CDL may be granted with the following classifications, endorsements, and restrictions:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-412(1)(a): Classifications:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-412(1)(a)(i): Class A: any combination of vehicles with a GVWR of 26,001 pounds or more, if the GVWR of the one or more vehicles being towed is in excess of 10,000 pounds;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-412(1)(a)(ii): Class B: any single motor vehicle with a GVWR of 26,001 pounds or more, including that motor vehicle when towing a vehicle with a GVWR of 10,000 pounds or less; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-412(1)(a)(iii): Class C: any single motor vehicle with a GVWR of less than 26,001 pounds or that motor vehicle when towing a vehicle with a GVWR of 10,000 pounds or less when the vehicle is designed:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-412(1)(a)(iii)(A): to carry 16 or more passengers, including the driver;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-412(1)(a)(iii)(B): as a school bus, and weighing less than 26,001 pounds GVWR; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-412(1)(a)(iii)(C): to transport hazardous materials that requires the vehicle to be placarded under 49 C.F.R. Part 172, Subpart F.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-412(1)(b): Endorsements:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-412(1)(b)(i): "H" authorizes the driver to drive a commercial motor vehicle transporting hazardous materials as defined in 49 C.F.R. Sec. 383.5.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-412(1)(b)(ii): "N" authorizes the driver to drive a tank vehicle.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-412(1)(b)(iii): "P" authorizes the driver to drive a motor vehicle designed to carry 16 or more passengers including the driver.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-412(1)(b)(iv): "S" authorizes the driver to transport preprimary, primary, or secondary school students from home to school, school to home, or to and from school-sponsored events.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-412(1)(b)(v): "T" authorizes the driver to drive a commercial motor vehicle with a double or triple trailer.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-412(1)(b)(vi): "X" authorizes the driver to drive a tank vehicle and transport hazardous materials.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-412(1)(c): Restrictions:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-412(1)(c)(i): "E" restricts the driver from driving a commercial motor vehicle with a manual transmission.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-412(1)(c)(ii): "K" restricts the driver to driving intrastate only any commercial motor vehicle as defined by 49 C.F.R. Parts 383 and 390.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-412(1)(c)(iii): "L" restricts the driver to driving a commercial motor vehicle not equipped with air brakes.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-412(1)(c)(iv): "J" provides for other CDL restrictions.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-412(1)(c)(v): "M" restricts a driver from transporting passengers using a class A bus.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-412(1)(c)(vi): "N" restricts a driver from transporting passengers using a class A or class B bus.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-412(1)(c)(vii): "O" restricts a driver from driving a commercial motor vehicle equipped with a tractor trailer.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-412(1)(c)(viii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-412(1)(c)(viii)(A): "V" indicates that the driver has been issued a variance by the Federal Motor Carrier Safety Administration in reference to the driver's medical certification status.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-412(1)(c)(viii)(B): A driver with a "V" restriction shall have the letter outlining the specifications for the variance in the driver's possession along with the driver's commercial driver license when operating a commercial motor vehicle.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-412(1)(c)(ix): "Z" restricts a driver from driving a commercial motor vehicle with non-fully equipped air brakes.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-412(2): A commercial driver instruction permit may be granted with the following classifications, endorsements, and restrictions:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-412(2)(a): Classifications:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-412(2)(a)(i): Class A: any combination of vehicles with a GVWR of 26,001 pounds or more, if the GVWR of the one or more vehicles being towed is in excess of 10,000 pounds;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-412(2)(a)(ii): Class B: any single motor vehicle with a GVWR of 26,001 pounds or more, including that motor vehicle when towing a vehicle with a GVWR of 10,000 pounds or less; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-412(2)(a)(iii): Class C: any single motor vehicle with a GVWR of less than 26,001 pounds or that motor vehicle when towing a vehicle with a GVWR of 10,000 pounds or less when the vehicle is designed:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-412(2)(a)(iii)(A): to carry 16 or more passengers, including the driver;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-412(2)(a)(iii)(B): as a school bus, and weighing less than 26,001 pounds GVWR; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-412(2)(a)(iii)(C): to transport hazardous material that requires the vehicle to be placarded under 49 C.F.R. Part 172, Subpart F.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-412(2)(b): Endorsements:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-412(2)(b)(i): "N" authorizes the driver to drive a tank vehicle.  An "N" endorsement may only be issued with an "X" restriction.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-412(2)(b)(ii): "P" authorizes the driver to drive a motor vehicle designed to carry 16 or more passengers including the driver.  A "P" endorsement may only be issued with a "P" restriction.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-412(2)(b)(iii): "S" authorizes the driver to transport preprimary, primary, or secondary school students from home to school, school to home, or to and from school-sponsored events.  An "S" endorsement may only be issued with a "P" restriction.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-412(2)(c): Restrictions:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-412(2)(c)(i): "K" restricts the driver to driving intrastate only any commercial motor vehicle as defined by 49 C.F.R. Parts 383 and 390.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-412(2)(c)(ii): "L" restricts the driver to driving a commercial motor vehicle not equipped with air brakes.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-412(2)(c)(iii): "M" restricts a driver from transporting passengers using a class A bus.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-412(2)(c)(iv): "N" restricts a driver from transporting passengers using a class A or class B bus.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-412(2)(c)(v): "P" restricts a driver from having one or more passengers in the vehicle while driving a commercial motor vehicle bus unless the passenger is:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-412(2)(c)(v)(A): a federal or state auditor or inspector;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-412(2)(c)(v)(B): a test examiner;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-412(2)(c)(v)(C): another trainee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-412(2)(c)(v)(D): the CDL holder accompanying the CDIP holder as required in 49 C.F.R. Sec. 383.25.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-412(2)(c)(vi): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-412(2)(c)(vi)(A): "V" indicates that the driver has been issued a variance by the Federal Motor Carrier Safety Administration in reference to the driver's medical certification status.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-412(2)(c)(vi)(B): A driver with a "V" restriction shall have the letter outlining the specifications for the variance in the driver's possession along with the driver's commercial driver license when operating a commercial motor vehicle.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-412(2)(c)(vii): "X" restricts a driver from having cargo in a commercial motor vehicle tank vehicle.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-412(3): A violation of this section is an infraction.


Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-413 Issuance of CDL by division -- Driving record -- Expiration date -- Renewal -- Hazardous materials provision.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-413(1): Before the division may grant a CDL, the division shall obtain the driving record information regarding the applicant through the CDLIS, the NDR, and from each state where the applicant has been licensed.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-413(2): The division shall notify the CDLIS and provide all information required to ensure identification of the CDL holder within 10 days after:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-413(2)(a): issuing a CDL following application for an original, renewal, transfer, or upgrade of the CDL; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-413(2)(b): any change is made to the identifying information of a CDL holder.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-413(3): (3)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-413(3)(a): The expiration date for a CDL is the birth date of the holder in the fifth year following the year of issuance of the CDL.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-413(3)(b): (3)(a) A limited-term CDL expires on:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-413(3)(b)(i): (3)(a) the expiration date of the period of time of the individual's authorized stay in the United States or on the date provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-413(3)(b)(ii): on the birth date of the applicant in the first year following the year that the limited-term CDL was issued if there is no definite end to the individual's period of authorized stay.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-413(3)(c): A CDL held by an individual ordered to active duty and stationed outside Utah in any of the armed forces of the United States, which expires during the time period the individual is stationed outside of the state, is valid until 90 days after the individual has been discharged or has left the service, unless:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-413(3)(c)(i): the license is suspended, disqualified, denied, or has been cancelled or revoked by the division; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-413(3)(c)(ii): the licensee updates the information or photograph on the license certificate.

Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-413(4)(a): 53-3-410 The applicant for a renewal of a CDL shall complete the application form required by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-413(4)(b): (4)(a) In addition to the requirements under Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-413(5)(a): that it is temporary; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-413(5)(b): its expiration date.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-413(6): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-413(6)(a): The division may not issue a hazardous materials endorsement on a CDL unless the applicant meets the security threat assessment standards of the federal Transportation Security Administration.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-413(6)(b): The division shall revoke the hazardous materials endorsement on a CDL upon receiving notice from the federal Transportation Security Administration that the individual holding a hazardous materials endorsement does not meet Transportation Security Administration security threat assessment standards.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-413(6)(c): To obtain an original hazardous materials endorsement or retain a hazardous materials endorsement upon CDL renewal or transfer, the applicant must take and pass the knowledge test for hazardous materials endorsement in addition to any other testing required by the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-413(7): Unless otherwise provided, the provisions, requirements, classes, endorsements, fees, restrictions, and sanctions under this code apply to a limited-term CDL in the same way as a CDL issued under this chapter.


Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-414 CDL disqualification or suspension -- Grounds and duration -- Procedure.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-414(1): 41-6a-401.3; 41-6a-401.5; 76-5-205; 76-5-206; 76-5-207
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-414(1)(a): 41-6a-401.3; 41-6a-401.5; 76-5-205; 76-5-206; 76-5-207 An individual who holds or is required to hold a CDL is disqualified from driving a commercial motor vehicle for a period of not less than one year effective seven days from the date of notice to the driver if convicted of a first offense of:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-414(1)(a)(i): driving a motor vehicle while under the influence of alcohol, drugs, a controlled substance, or more than one of these;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-414(1)(a)(ii): driving a commercial motor vehicle while the concentration of alcohol in the person's blood, breath, or urine is .04 grams or more;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-414(1)(a)(iii): leaving the scene of an accident involving a motor vehicle the person was driving;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-414(1)(a)(iv): 41-6a-401.3; 41-6a-401.5 failing to provide reasonable assistance or identification when involved in an accident resulting in:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-414(1)(a)(iv)(A): 41-6a-401.3 personal injury in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-414(1)(a)(iv)(B): 41-6a-401.5 death in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-414(1)(a)(v): using a motor vehicle in the commission of a felony;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-414(1)(a)(vi): refusal to submit to a test to determine the concentration of alcohol in the person's blood, breath, or urine;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-414(1)(a)(vii): driving a commercial motor vehicle while the person's commercial driver license is disqualified in accordance with the provisions of this section for violating an offense described in this section; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-414(1)(a)(viii): 76-5-205; 76-5-206; 76-5-207 operating a commercial motor vehicle in a negligent manner causing the death of another including the offenses of manslaughter under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-414(1)(b): The division shall subtract from any disqualification period under Subsection (1)(a)(i) the number of days for which a license was previously disqualified under Subsection (1)(a)(ii) or (14) if the previous disqualification was based on the same occurrence upon which the record of conviction is based.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-414(2): If any of the violations under Subsection (1) occur while the driver is transporting a hazardous material required to be placarded, the driver is disqualified for not less than three years.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-414(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-414(3)(a): Except as provided under Subsection (4), a driver of a motor vehicle who holds or is required to hold a CDL is disqualified for life from driving a commercial motor vehicle if convicted of or administrative action is taken for two or more of any of the offenses under Subsection (1), (5), or (14) arising from two or more separate incidents.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-414(3)(b): Subsection (3)(a) applies only to those offenses committed after July 1, 1989.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-414(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-414(4)(a): Any driver disqualified for life from driving a commercial motor vehicle under this section may apply to the division for reinstatement of the driver's CDL if the driver:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-414(4)(a)(i): has both voluntarily enrolled in and successfully completed an appropriate rehabilitation program that:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-414(4)(a)(i)(A): meets the standards of the division; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-414(4)(a)(i)(B): complies with 49 C.F.R. Sec. 383.51;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-414(4)(a)(ii): has served a minimum disqualification period of 10 years; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-414(4)(a)(iii): has fully met the standards for reinstatement of commercial motor vehicle driving privileges established by rule of the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-414(4)(b): If a reinstated driver is subsequently convicted of another disqualifying offense under this section, the driver is permanently disqualified for life and is ineligible to again apply for a reduction of the lifetime disqualification.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-414(5): A driver of a motor vehicle who holds or is required to hold a CDL is disqualified for life from driving a commercial motor vehicle if the driver uses a motor vehicle in the commission of any felony involving:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-414(5)(a): the manufacturing, distributing, or dispensing of a controlled substance, or possession with intent to manufacture, distribute, or dispense a controlled substance and is ineligible to apply for a reduction of the lifetime disqualification under Subsection (4); or
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-414(5)(b): an act or practice of severe forms of trafficking in persons as defined and described in 22 U.S.C. Sec. 7102(11).
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-414(6): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-414(6)(a): Subject to Subsection (6)(b), a driver of a commercial motor vehicle who holds or is required to hold a CDL is disqualified for not less than:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-414(6)(a)(i): 60 days from driving a commercial motor vehicle if the driver is convicted of two serious traffic violations; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-414(6)(a)(ii): 120 days if the driver is convicted of three or more serious traffic violations.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-414(6)(b): The disqualifications under Subsection (6)(a) are effective only if the serious traffic violations:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-414(6)(b)(i): occur within three years of each other;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-414(6)(b)(ii): arise from separate incidents; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-414(6)(b)(iii): involve the use or operation of a commercial motor vehicle.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-414(6)(c): If a driver of a commercial motor vehicle who holds or is required to hold a CDL is disqualified from driving a commercial motor vehicle and the division receives notice of a subsequent conviction for a serious traffic violation that results in an additional disqualification period under this Subsection (6), the subsequent disqualification period is effective beginning on the ending date of the current serious traffic violation disqualification period.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-414(7): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-414(7)(a): A driver of a commercial motor vehicle who is convicted of violating an out-of-service order while driving a commercial motor vehicle is disqualified from driving a commercial motor vehicle for a period not less than:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-414(7)(a)(i): 180 days if the driver is convicted of a first violation;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-414(7)(a)(ii): two years if, during any 10 year period, the driver is convicted of two violations of out-of-service orders in separate incidents;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-414(7)(a)(iii): three years but not more than five years if, during any 10 year period, the driver is convicted of three or more violations of out-of-service orders in separate incidents;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-414(7)(a)(iv): 180 days but not more than two years if the driver is convicted of a first violation of an out-of-service order while transporting hazardous materials required to be placarded or while operating a motor vehicle designed to transport 16 or more passengers, including the driver; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-414(7)(a)(v): three years but not more than five years if, during any 10 year period, the driver is convicted of two or more violations, in separate incidents, of an out-of-service order while transporting hazardous materials required to be placarded or while operating a motor vehicle designed to transport 16 or more passengers, including the driver.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-414(7)(b): A driver of a commercial motor vehicle who is convicted of a first violation of an out-of-service order is subject to a civil penalty of not less than $2,500.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-414(7)(c): A driver of a commercial motor vehicle who is convicted of a second or subsequent violation of an out-of-service order is subject to a civil penalty of not less than $5,000.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-414(8): A driver of a commercial motor vehicle who holds or is required to hold a CDL is disqualified for not less than 60 days if the division determines, in its check of the driver's driver license status, application, and record prior to issuing a CDL or at any time after the CDL is issued, that the driver has falsified information required to apply for a CDL in this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-414(9): 41-6a-1205 A driver of a commercial motor vehicle who is convicted of violating a railroad-highway grade crossing provision under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-414(9)(a): 60 days if the driver is convicted of a first violation;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-414(9)(b): 120 days if, during any three-year period, the driver is convicted of a second violation in separate incidents; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-414(9)(c): one year if, during any three-year period, the driver is convicted of three or more violations in separate incidents.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-414(10): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-414(10)(a): The division shall update its records and notify the CDLIS within 10 days of suspending, revoking, disqualifying, denying, or cancelling a CDL to reflect the action taken.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-414(10)(b): When the division suspends, revokes, cancels, or disqualifies a nonresident CDL, the division shall notify the licensing authority of the issuing state or other jurisdiction and the CDLIS within 10 days after the action is taken.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-414(10)(c): When the division suspends, revokes, cancels, or disqualifies a CDL issued by this state, the division shall notify the CDLIS within 10 days after the action is taken.

Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-414(13): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-414(13)(a): Upon receiving a notice that a person has entered into a plea of guilty or no contest to a violation of a disqualifying offense described in this section which plea is held in abeyance pursuant to a plea in abeyance agreement, the division shall disqualify, suspend, cancel, or revoke the person's CDL for the period required under this section for a conviction of that disqualifying offense, even if the charge has been subsequently reduced or dismissed in accordance with the plea in abeyance agreement.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-414(13)(b): The division shall report the plea in abeyance to the CDLIS within 10 days of taking the action under Subsection (13)(a).
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-414(13)(c): A plea which is held in abeyance may not be removed from a person's driving record for 10 years from the date of the plea in abeyance agreement, even if the charge is:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-414(13)(c)(i): reduced or dismissed in accordance with the plea in abeyance agreement; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-414(13)(c)(ii): expunged under Title 77, Chapter 40a, Expungement of Criminal Records.

Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-414(15): The division may concurrently impose any disqualification periods that arise under this section while a driver is disqualified by the Secretary of the United States Department of Transportation under 49 C.F.R. Sec. 383.52 for posing an imminent hazard.

Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-416 Driving record and other information to be provided to employer.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-416(1): Each person who drives a commercial motor vehicle who has a CDL issued by this state and who is convicted of violating, in any type of motor vehicle, a state or local law relating to motor vehicle traffic, other than a parking violation, in this or any other state or jurisdiction, shall notify both the division and his current employer of the conviction within 30 days of the date of conviction.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-416(2): A driver shall notify his current employer before the end of the business day following the day he receives notice that:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-416(2)(a): his CDL is suspended, revoked, or canceled by any state;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-416(2)(b): he loses the privilege to drive a commercial motor vehicle in any state or other jurisdiction for any period; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-416(2)(c): he is disqualified from driving a commercial motor vehicle for any period.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-416(3): (3)(a) A person who applies to be a commercial motor vehicle driver shall at the time of application provide to the employer the following information for the 10 years prior to the date of application:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-416(3)(a): a list of the names and addresses of the applicant's previous employers for which the applicant was a driver of a commercial motor vehicle as any part of his employment;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-416(3)(b): (3)(a) the dates between which the applicant drove for each employer listed under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-416(3)(c): the reason the applicant's employment with each employer listed was terminated.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-416(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-416(4)(a): An applicant shall certify that all information provided under this section is true and complete to the best of his knowledge.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-416(4)(b): An employer receiving information under this section may require that an applicant provide additional information.


Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-417 Measurable alcohol amount consumed -- Penalty -- Refusal to take test for alcohol.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-417(1): A person who holds or is required to hold a CDL may not drive a commercial motor vehicle while there is any measurable or detectable alcohol in his body.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-417(2): (1) The division, a port-of-entry agent, or a peace officer shall place a person out-of-service for 24 consecutive hours who:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-417(2)(a): (1) violates Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-417(2)(b): refuses a request to submit to a test to determine the alcohol concentration of his blood, breath, or urine.


Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-418 Prohibited alcohol level for drivers -- Procedures, including hearing.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-418(1): A person who holds or is required to hold a CDL may not drive a commercial motor vehicle in this state if the person:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-418(1)(a): has sufficient alcohol in the person's body that a subsequent chemical test shows that the person has a blood or breath alcohol concentration of .04 grams or greater at the time of the test after the alleged driving of the commercial motor vehicle;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-418(1)(b): is under the influence of alcohol, any drug, or the combined influence of alcohol and any drug to degree that renders the person incapable of safely driving a commercial motor vehicle; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-418(1)(c): has a blood or breath alcohol concentration of .04 grams or greater at the time of driving the commercial motor vehicle.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-418(2): A person who holds or is required to hold a CDL and who drives a commercial motor vehicle in this state is considered to have given the person's consent to a test or tests of the person's blood, breath, or urine to determine the concentration of alcohol or the presence of other drugs in the person's physical system.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-418(3): 41-6a-515 If a peace officer or port-of-entry agent has reasonable cause to believe that a person may be violating this section, the peace officer or port-of-entry agent may request the person to submit to a chemical test to be administered in compliance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-418(4): (1); 53-3-414 When a peace officer or port-of-entry agent requests a person to submit to a test under this section, the peace officer or port-of-entry agent shall advise the person that test results indicating a violation of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-418(5): (1) If test results under this section indicate a violation of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-418(6): (5) When a peace officer or port-of-entry agent gives notice under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-418(6)(a): provide the driver, in a manner specified by the division, basic information regarding how to obtain a prompt hearing before the division; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-418(6)(b): issue a 24-hour out-of-service order.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-418(7): As a matter of procedure, a peace officer or port-of-entry agent shall, within 10 calendar days after the day on which notice is provided, send to the division a copy of the notice, and a report signed by the peace officer or port-of-entry agent that indicates the results of any chemical test administered or that the person refused a test.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-418(8): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-418(8)(a): A person disqualified under this section has the right to a hearing regarding the disqualification.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-418(8)(b): The request for the hearing shall be submitted to the division in a manner specified by the division and shall be made within 10 calendar days of the date the notice was issued.  If requested, the hearing shall be conducted within 29 days after the date of arrest.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-418(9): (9)(a)(ii)
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-418(9)(a): (9)(a)(ii)
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-418(9)(a)(i): (9)(a)(ii) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-418(9)(a)(i)(A): the county where the notice was issued; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-418(9)(a)(i)(B): a county that is adjacent to the county where the notice was issued.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-418(9)(a)(ii): The division may hold a hearing in some other county if the division and the person both agree.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-418(9)(b): The hearing shall be documented and shall determine:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-418(9)(b)(i): whether the peace officer or port-of-entry agent had reasonable grounds to believe the person had been driving a motor vehicle in violation of this section;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-418(9)(b)(ii): whether the person refused to submit to any requested test; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-418(9)(b)(iii): any test results obtained.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-418(9)(c): In connection with a hearing the division or its authorized agent may administer oaths and may issue subpoenas for the attendance of witnesses and the production of relevant books and documents.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-418(9)(d): One or more members of the division may conduct the hearing.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-418(9)(e): A decision made after a hearing before any number of members of the division is as valid as if the hearing were held before the full membership of the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-418(9)(f): After a hearing under this section the division shall indicate by order if the person's CDL is disqualified.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-418(9)(g): If the person for whom the hearing is held fails to appear before the division as required in the notice, the division shall indicate by order if the person's CDL is disqualified.

Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-419 Nonresident driver violations reported to resident state.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-419(1): When the division receives a report of the conviction or plea in abeyance of a nonresident holder of a CDL for a violation of a state law or local ordinance relating to traffic control, the division shall notify the driver licensing authority in the licensing state within five days of receipt of the report.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-419(2): This section does not apply to parking violations.

Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-501 Short title.
-------------------------------------------
This part is known as the "Commercial Driver Training Schools Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-502 Definitions.
-------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-502(1): (1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-502(1)(a): "Commercial driver training school" or "school" means a business enterprise conducted by an individual, association, partnership, or corporation for the education and training of persons, either practically or theoretically, or both, to:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-502(1)(a)(i): drive motor vehicles, including motorcycles; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-502(1)(a)(ii): prepare an applicant for an examination given by the state for a license or learner permit.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-502(1)(b): (1)(a) A commercial driver training school may charge a consideration or tuition for the services described under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-502(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-502(2)(a): "Commercial testing only school" means a business enterprise conducted by an individual, association, partnership, or corporation that:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-502(2)(a)(i): is designated by the division as a commercial testing only school;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-502(2)(a)(ii): employs instructors who are certified by the division; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-502(2)(a)(iii): engages only in testing students for the purpose of obtaining a driver license.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-502(2)(b): A commercial testing only school may conduct behind-the-wheel or observation instruction if approved by the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-502(2)(c): A commercial testing only school may not engage in education or training of persons, either practically or theoretically, or both to drive motor vehicles, except when:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-502(2)(c)(i): counseling the driver following a test in reference to errors made during the administration of the test; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-502(2)(c)(ii): conducting behind-the-wheel or observation instruction if approved by the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-502(2)(d): A commercial testing only school may not test an individual who has completed any behind-the-wheel or observation instruction through the school with which the tester is employed.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-502(3): "Instructor" means a person, whether acting as an operator of a commercial driver training school or for a school for compensation, who:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-502(3)(a): teaches, conducts classes of, gives demonstrations to, or supervises practice of persons learning to drive motor vehicles, including motorcycles;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-502(3)(b): prepares persons to take an examination for a license or learner permit; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-502(3)(c): supervises the work of any other instructor.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-502(4): "Observation time" means a period of time during which a driver education student observes another student, instructor, or road user.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-502(5): "School operator" means a person who:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-502(5)(a): is certified as an instructor;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-502(5)(b): has met the requirements for school operator status as established by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-502(5)(c): is authorized or certified to operate or manage a driver training school; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-502(5)(d): may supervise the work of another instructor.


Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-503 Exemption for college, university, and high school programs.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
This part does not apply to any person giving driver training lessons to schools or classes conducted by colleges, universities, and high schools for regularly enrolled full-time students as a part of the normal program for the institutions.

Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-504 Licenses required -- Inspections.
----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-504(1): A commercial driver training school or a commercial testing only school may be established only if the school applies for and obtains a license from the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-504(2): A person may act as an instructor or school operator only if the person applies for and obtains a license from the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-504(3): The  division shall inspect the school facilities and equipment of applicants and licensees and examine applicants for instructor's licenses.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-504(4): The division shall administer and enforce this part.

Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-506 License expiration and renewal -- Fee required -- Disposition of revenue.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-506(1): 63J-1-504
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-506(1)(a): All commercial driver training school licenses, commercial testing only school licenses, school operator licenses, and instructor licenses:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-506(1)(a)(i): expire one year from the date of issuance; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-506(1)(a)(ii): may be renewed upon application to the commissioner as prescribed by rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-506(1)(b): 63J-1-504 Each application for an original or renewal school license, school operator license, or instructor license shall be accompanied by a fee determined by the department under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-506(1)(c): A license fee may not be refunded if the license is rejected, suspended, or revoked.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-506(2): The license fees collected under this part shall be:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-506(2)(a): placed in a fund designated as the "Commercial Driver Training Law Fund"; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-506(2)(b): used under the supervision and direction of the director of the Division of Finance for the administration of this part.


Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-507 Licenses -- Cancellation, revocation, or refusal to issue or renew -- Ineligibility for license.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-507(1): The department may cancel, revoke, or refuse to issue or renew a commercial driver training school, commercial testing only school, school operator, or instructor license if it finds that the licensee or applicant has not complied with, or has violated this part or any rule made by the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-507(2): A licensee:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-507(2)(a): shall return a canceled or revoked license to the division; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-507(2)(b): is not eligible to apply for a license under this part until six months have elapsed since the date of a cancellation or revocation under this section.


Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-508 Local boards of education may conduct class for adults.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Local boards of education, with the consent of the division, may conduct classes in driver education for adult members of the district in those areas of the state where no commercial driver training course is available, and may charge a fee not to exceed the cost of the training.

Utah Code Annotated § 53-3-509 Violations -- Penalties.
-------------------------------------------------------
A violation of this part is a class C misdemeanor.
