Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-105 School guardian program.
--------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-105(1): 76-10-501; 53G-8-701.5(3) As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-105(1)(a): "Annual training" means an annual four-hour training that:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-105(1)(a)(i): a county security chief or a designee administers;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-105(1)(a)(ii): the state security chief approves;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-105(1)(a)(iii): can be tailored to local needs;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-105(1)(a)(iv): allows an individual to practice and demonstrate firearms proficiency at a firearms range using the firearm the individual carries for self defense and defense of others;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-105(1)(a)(v): includes the following components:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-105(1)(a)(v)(A): firearm safety, including safe storage of a firearm;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-105(1)(a)(v)(B): de-escalation tactics;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-105(1)(a)(v)(C): the role of mental health in incidents; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-105(1)(a)(v)(D): disability awareness and interactions; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-105(1)(a)(vi): contains other training needs as determined by the state security chief.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-105(1)(b): "Biannual training" means a twice-yearly training that:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-105(1)(b)(i): is at least four hours, unless otherwise approved by the state security chief;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-105(1)(b)(ii): a county security chief or a designee administers;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-105(1)(b)(iii): the state security chief approves;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-105(1)(b)(iv): can be tailored to local needs; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-105(1)(b)(v): through which a school guardian at a school or simulated school environment:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-105(1)(b)(v)(A): receives training on the specifics of the building or buildings of the school, including the location of emergency supplies and security infrastructure; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-105(1)(b)(v)(B): participates in a live-action practice plan with school administrators in responding to active threats at the school; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-105(1)(b)(vi): shall be taken with at least three months in between the two trainings.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-105(1)(c): 76-10-501 "Firearm" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-105(1)(d): "Initial training" means an in-person training that:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-105(1)(d)(i): a county security chief or a designee administers;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-105(1)(d)(ii): the state security chief approves;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-105(1)(d)(iii): can be tailored to local needs; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-105(1)(d)(iv): provides:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-105(1)(d)(iv)(A): training on general familiarity with the types of firearms that can be concealed for self-defense and defense of others;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-105(1)(d)(iv)(B): training on the safe loading, unloading, storage, and carrying of firearms in a school setting;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-105(1)(d)(iv)(C): training at a firearms range with instruction regarding firearms fundamentals, marksmanship, the demonstration and explanation of the difference between sight picture, sight alignment, and trigger control, and a recognized pistol course;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-105(1)(d)(iv)(D): current laws dealing with the lawful use of a firearm by a private citizen, including laws on self-defense, defense of others, transportation of firearms, and concealment of firearms;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-105(1)(d)(iv)(E): coordination with law enforcement officers in the event of an active threat;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-105(1)(d)(iv)(F): basic trauma first aid;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-105(1)(d)(iv)(G): the appropriate use of force, emphasizing the de-escalation of force and alternatives to using force;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-105(1)(d)(iv)(H): situational response evaluations, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-105(1)(d)(iv)(H)(I): protecting and securing a crime or accident scene;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-105(1)(d)(iv)(H)(II): notifying law enforcement;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-105(1)(d)(iv)(H)(III): controlling information; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-105(1)(d)(iv)(H)(IV): other training that the county sheriff, designee, or department deems appropriate.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-105(1)(e): "Program" means the school guardian program created in this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-105(1)(f): 53G-8-701.5(3)
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-105(1)(f)(i): "School employee" means an employee of a school whose duties and responsibilities require the employee to be physically present at a school's campus while school is in session.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-105(1)(f)(ii): 53G-8-701.5(3) "School employee" does not include a principal, teacher, or individual whose primary responsibilities require the employee to be primarily present in a classroom to teach, care for, or interact with students, unless:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-105(1)(f)(ii)(A): the principal, teacher, or individual is employed at a school with 100 or fewer students;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-105(1)(f)(ii)(B): the principal, teacher, or individual is employed at a school with adjacent campuses as determined by the state security chief; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-105(1)(f)(ii)(C): 53G-8-701.5(3) as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-105(1)(g): "School guardian" means a school employee who meets the requirements of Subsection (3).
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-105(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-105(2)(a):

Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-105(4)(c): provide each school guardian with a one-time stipend of $500.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-105(5): A school guardian:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-105(5)(a): may store the school guardian's firearm on the grounds of a school only if:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-105(5)(a)(i): the firearm is stored in a biometric gun safe;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-105(5)(a)(ii): the biometric gun safe is located in the school guardian's office; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-105(5)(a)(iii): the school guardian is physically present on the grounds of the school while the firearm is stored in the safe;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-105(5)(b): shall carry the school guardian's firearm in a concealed manner; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-105(5)(c): may not, unless during an active threat, display or open carry a firearm while on school grounds.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-105(6): 76-10-505.5 Except as provided in Subsection (5)(c), this section does not prohibit an individual who has a valid concealed carry permit but is not participating in the program from carrying a firearm on the grounds of a public school or charter school under Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-106 Substantial threats against a school reporting requirements -- Exceptions.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-106(1): As used in this section, "substantial threat" means a threat made with serious intent to cause harm.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-106(2): 76-5-404.1 Except as provided in Subsection (3), if a state employee or person in a position of special trust as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-106(2)(a): the state security chief;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-106(2)(b): the local education agency that the substantial threat would impact; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-106(2)(c): to the nearest peace officer or law enforcement agency.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-106(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-106(3)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-106(3)(a)(i): If the state security chief, a peace officer, or law enforcement agency receives a report under Subsection (2), the state security chief, peace officer, or law enforcement agency shall immediately notify the local education agency that the substantial threat would impact.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-106(3)(a)(ii): If the local education agency that the substantial threat would impact receives a report under Subsection (2), the local education agency that the substantial threat would impact shall immediately notify the appropriate local law enforcement agency and the state security chief.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-106(3)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-106(3)(b)(i): A local education agency that the substantial threat would impact shall coordinate with the law enforcement agency on the law enforcement agency's investigation of the report described in Subsection (1).
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-106(3)(b)(ii): If a law enforcement agency undertakes an investigation of a report under Subsection (2), the law enforcement agency shall provide a final investigatory report to the local education agency that the substantial threat would impact upon request.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-106(4): Subject to Subsection (5), the reporting requirement described in Subsection (2) does not apply to:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-106(4)(a): a member of the clergy with regard to any confession an individual makes to the member of the clergy while functioning in the ministerial capacity of the member of the clergy if:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-106(4)(a)(i): the individual made the confession directly to the member of the clergy;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-106(4)(a)(ii): the member of the clergy is, under canon law or church doctrine or practice, bound to maintain the confidentiality of the confession; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-106(4)(a)(iii): the member of the clergy does not have the consent of the individual making the confession to disclose the content of the confession; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-106(4)(b): an attorney, or an individual whom the attorney employs, if:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-106(4)(b)(i): the knowledge or belief of the substantial threat arises from the representation of a client; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-106(4)(b)(ii): if disclosure of the substantial threat would not reveal the substantial threat to prevent reasonably certain death or substantial bodily harm in accordance with Utah Rules of Professional Conduct, Rule 1.6.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-106(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-106(5)(a): When a member of the clergy receives information about the substantial threat from any source other than a confession, the member of the clergy shall report the information even if the member of the clergy also received information about the substantial threat from the confession of the perpetrator.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-106(5)(b): Exemption of the reporting requirement for an individual described in Subsection (4) does not exempt the individual from any other actions required by law to prevent further substantial threats or actual harm related to the substantial threat.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-106(6): The physician-patient privilege does not:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-106(6)(a): excuse an individual who is licensed under Title 58, Chapter 67, Utah Medical Practice Act, or Title 58, Chapter 68, Utah Osteopathic Medical Practice Act, from reporting under this section; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-106(6)(b): constitute grounds for excluding evidence in a judicial or administrative proceeding resulting from a report under this section.


Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-107 Educator-Protector Program.
-----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-107(1): 53-22-103; 53-10-201; 53E-1-102 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-107(1)(a): 53-22-103 "Annual classroom response training" means a training for a teacher:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-107(1)(a)(i): 53-22-103 that is held at least once a year and is administered, at no cost to a teacher, by the individual identified by the county sheriff as described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-107(1)(a)(ii): where the teacher is trained:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-107(1)(a)(ii)(A): on how to defend a classroom against active threats emphasizing the teacher's role in stationary defense; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-107(1)(a)(ii)(B): on the safe loading, unloading, storage, and carrying of firearms in a school setting.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-107(1)(b): 53-10-201 "Bureau" means the Bureau of Criminal Identification created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-107(1)(c): 53E-1-102 "Local education agency" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-107(1)(d): "Program" means the Educator-Protector Program created under this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-107(1)(e): "Teacher" means an individual employed by a local education agency who has an assignment to teach in a classroom.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-107(2): There is created the Educator-Protector Program to incentivize a teacher to responsibly secure or carry a firearm on the grounds of the school where the teacher is employed.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-107(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-107(3)(a): To participate in the program, a teacher shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-107(3)(a)(i): have completed an annual classroom response training within six months before the day on which the teacher joins the program;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-107(3)(a)(ii): have a valid concealed carry permit issued under Title 53, Chapter 5, Part 7, Concealed Firearm Act; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-107(3)(a)(iii): certify to the department that:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-107(3)(a)(iii)(A): the teacher satisfies the requirements described in Subsections (3)(a)(i) and (3)(a)(ii); and
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-107(3)(a)(iii)(B): if applicable, intends to securely store or carry a firearm on the grounds of a school where the teacher is employed.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-107(3)(b): After joining the program, to retain the teacher's active status in the program, a teacher shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-107(3)(b)(i): participate in annual classroom response training; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-107(3)(b)(ii): comply with any rules established by the department in accordance with Subsection (10).
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-107(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-107(4)(a): The state security chief shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-107(4)(a)(i): track each teacher that participates in the program by collecting a photograph, name, and contact information for each teacher;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-107(4)(a)(ii): make the information described in Subsection (4)(a) readily available to each law enforcement agency in the state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-107(4)(a)(iii): provide reasonable reimbursement, using funds appropriated by the Legislature, to a county sheriff for providing a teacher with annual classroom response training.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-107(4)(b): The state security chief shall categorize the information described in Subsection (4)(a)(i) by school.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-107(5): A teacher participating in the program:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-107(5)(a): may store the teacher's firearm on the grounds of a school only if:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-107(5)(a)(i): the firearm is stored in a biometric gun safe;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-107(5)(a)(ii): the biometric gun safe is located in the teacher's classroom or office; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-107(5)(a)(iii): the teacher is physically present on the grounds of the school while the firearm is stored in the biometric gun safe; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-107(5)(b): shall carry the teacher's firearm in a concealed manner unless during an active threat.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-107(6): 76-10-505.5 This section does not prohibit an individual who has a valid concealed carry permit but is not participating in the program from carrying firearms on the grounds of a school as described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-107(7): 76-2-402
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-107(7)(a): 76-2-402 A teacher who has active status in the program is not liable for any civil damages or penalties if the teacher:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-107(7)(a)(i): when carrying or storing a firearm:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-107(7)(a)(i)(A): is acting in good faith; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-107(7)(a)(i)(B): is not grossly negligent; or
Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-107(7)(a)(ii): 76-2-402 threatens, draws, or otherwise uses a firearm reasonably believing the action to be necessary in compliance with Section

Utah Code Annotated § 53-22-107(8): A local education agency may not prevent a teacher from participating in the program under this section.

Utah Code Annotated - Title 53 - Chapter 25 - Law Enforcement Requirements

Utah Code Annotated § 53-25-101 Prohibition on disclosure of identity of minor homicide victim.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53-25-101(1): 76-5-201 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-25-101(1)(a): 76-5-201 "Criminal homicide" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 53-25-101(1)(b): "Media outlet" means a bona fide newspaper, magazine, or broadcast media enterprise, whether conducted on a for-profit or nonprofit basis, engaged in the business of providing news and information to the general public.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-25-101(1)(c): "Minor victim" means the victim of a criminal homicide if the victim is younger than 18 years old.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-25-101(1)(d): "Parent or legal guardian" does not include an individual who is a suspect or defendant with respect to the criminal homicide.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-25-101(2): A law enforcement agency or a law enforcement officer may not disclose the name or other personally identifying information of a minor victim to a representative of a media outlet unless the law enforcement agency or law enforcement officer has made a reasonable effort to obtain the consent of the minor victim's parent or legal guardian for the disclosure.


Utah Code Annotated § 53-25-102 Standards for oral fluid and portable breath tests -- Rulemaking.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53-25-102(1): In accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act, the department shall make rules to establish standards for the proper use of oral fluid and portable breath testing as part of a field sobriety test.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-25-102(2): Each law enforcement agency shall provide training to ensure that:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-25-102(2)(a): oral fluid and portable breath testing techniques and practices comply with the rules described in Subsection (1); and
Utah Code Annotated § 53-25-102(2)(b): oral fluid and portable breath testing equipment is used in a manner consistent with manufacturer and industry standards.

Utah Code Annotated § 53-25-201 Sexual assault offense policy and public information requirements for law enforcement agencies.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 53-25-201(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 53-25-201(1)(a): Beginning January 1, 2024, a law enforcement agency shall create and maintain a policy regarding the law enforcement agency's processes for handling sexual assault investigations.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-25-201(1)(b): A policy described under Subsection (1)(a) shall include current best practices for handling sexual assault investigations, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-25-201(1)(b)(i): protocols and training on responses to sexual trauma;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-25-201(1)(b)(ii): emergency response procedures, including prompt contact with the victim and the preservation of evidence; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53-25-201(1)(b)(iii): referrals to sexual assault support services.
Utah Code Annotated § 53-25-201(1)(c): A law enforcement agency shall publicly post on the law enforcement agency's website the policy described in Subsection (1)(a).
Utah Code Annotated § 53-25-201(2): Beginning January 1, 2024, a law enforcement agency shall create and publicly post on the law enforcement agency's website a guide for victims of sexual assault that includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 53-25-201(2)(a): a description of the law enforcement agency's processes for handling sexual assault investigations;
Utah Code Annotated § 53-25-201(2)(b): contact information for victims of sexual assault to obtain more information from the law enforcement agency; and
Utah Code Annotated § 53-25-201(2)(c): referral information for sexual assault victim support services.
